intro: Pyrrocoma uniflora var. gossypina, commonly known as the cottonleaf pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
